Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: REMARK SEQUENCE NUMBER: Number in sequence for multiple observations of aremark type.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: BASE DEPTH: the base depth for which this remark is relevant.
Column Comment.4: BASE DEPTH ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure of the basedepth.
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: END WELL DRILLING PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for areporting period for well operations. Internationally, there may be 1, 2 or 3 periodseach 24 hours. In some jurisdictions, reporting may occur for more than oneperiod,such as for an 8 hour tour shift and a 24 daily summary.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.9: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.10: REMARK BY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTFIER: Unique identifier for theBusiness Associate who made this remark.
Column Comment.11: REMARK DATE: Date the remarks or comments were made.
Column Comment.12: REMARK TYPE: Entries in this column describe the general topic of the remark, sothat remarks can be grouped by subject area. Topics might include royaltycomments, well comments, deficiencies, rental billing comments, etc.
Column Comment.13: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.14: START WELL DRILLING PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for areporting period for well operations. Internationally, there may be 1, 2 or 3 periodseach 24 hours. In some jurisdictions, reporting may occur for more than one period,such as for an 8 hour tour shift and a 24 daily summary.
Column Comment.15: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.16: REMARK STRATIGRAPHIC UNT ID: The unique identifier for the strat unit that theremark relates to.
Column Comment.17: TOP DEPTH: the top depth for which this remark is relevant.
Column Comment.18: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
